intro: Chiangiodendron mexicanum, commonly known as the Mexican flame tree, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its striking orange-red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has simple, opposite leaves and produces fruit that splits open to release seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display. Chiangiodendron mexicanum thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
